chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force
Armed Robbery with Use of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Oscar O Higginbottom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay fine of $250 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   State shall have 60 days to determine restitution.
May not have contact with Juan H.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carl Johnson.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  4:50pm-  Victim rights compliance.  Defendant sentenced to WSP for 10 years: 5 years initial confinement & 5 years extended supervision w/ conditions - concurrent to Racine Co case.  Credit for 298 days.  Court orders $250.00 fine plus costs & DNA surcharge.  DE is eligible for CIP & the Substance Abuse Program.  State shall have 60 days to determine restitution.  DE to submit DNA sample (unless previously done).  Appeal rights given.
Today's Sentencing Hearing rescheduled to 06-11-15 at 3:30 pm as the DE has been transferred to WSP. DA's office to prepare a writ for the next hearing.
Amended Info
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carl Johnson.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  1:56pm-  Victim rights compliance.  Amended information filed.  DE acknowledges receipt & waives reading.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty; found guilty by the court.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carl Johnson.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:52am-  Victim rights compliance.  Attorney Johnson states matter may be resolved & requests an adjournment.  Court grants request.  Final pre-trial adjourned to January 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Bond continued.
Final pre-trial on December 10, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Due to ongoing jury trial (State v. Braithwaite), 10/16/2014 Final pre-trial is rescheduled to 12/10/2014 at 10am.  NTBS by the Court.
